history.content:
I made a pretty detailed post in @10667 and will be on staff for 16B next semester as well. I think you are in a really good spot if you have already taken both 54 and 110 with the grades you have. Content-wise I think you'll be more than comfortable with the material, but you may face some difficulty when it comes to the structure of the course.

16B is structured very similarly to 16A when it comes to course policies, homeworks, lectures, 2 discussions a week, and lab, so the first couple weeks may feel a bit overwhelming. For the circuits module, if you haven't taken an E&M physics class before, I would focus specifically on the following topics going into 16B: Nodal Analysis (KCL, Ohms Law), Voltage Dividers, and Op-Amps. Also when it comes to lab, I took 16B 3 semesters after taking 16A, so I forgot everything when it came to wiring circuits, but the lab TAs are friendly and helpful enough to reteach you how to handle the breadboard, that I was able to pick it up by around the third week. Don't worry about the kits too much, a lot of students haven't taken 16A, and or took it too long ago and lost theirs so they will give you a new kit the first day.

If you have any additional questions, feel free to ask or email me.

Hey all, as the title says, I'm taking 16b next semester without 16a. I also have no prior experience in circuits, but am very confident in my linear algebra(A+/A in math54/110). What is the best way to go about prepping for 16b? I'm planning on working through the circuits module of 16a on my own (homeworks and such), but should I also invest in a circuits kit to practice on? I heard the 16a kit carries over to 16b; how would I get my own kit before the class?

Honestly, any advice at all would be appreciated. Thank you!
history.subject: EE16B without 16A tips
